bvbSystem.name: Byggvarubedömningen (BVB)
bvbSystem.description: Sweden's established construction product assessment system evaluating products based on chemical content and lifecycle aspects. Over 30,000 assessed products in database.
bvbSystem.administrator: Non-profit economic association owned by Swedish construction industry stakeholders. IVL Svenska Miljöinstitutet plays key governance role.
bvbSystem.status: Voluntary but de facto market standard
bvbSystem.adoptionRate: 10,000+ logbooks across Sweden's largest projects. Major contractors (Skanska, NCC, Peab) use systematically.

levels.name: Recommended
levels.criteria: All chemical content criteria 'Recommended', no lifecycle criteria 'To be avoided', at least 50% of lifecycle criteria 'Recommended'

levels.name: Accepted
levels.criteria: No content criteria 'To be avoided', no lifecycle criteria 'To be avoided'

levels.name: To be avoided
levels.criteria: One or more content OR lifecycle criteria assessed as 'To be avoided'

assessmentProcess.applicant: Manufacturers or authorized representatives only (third-party assessment not permitted)
assessmentProcess.timeline: New assessment: 10 working days. Reassessment: 20 working days

recycledContent.notes: Only post-consumer material qualifies. Pre-consumer (production waste) excluded.

recyclability.accepted: ≥70% recyclable as fill/energy OR installation waste systems exist

hospitalitySectorUsage.requirement: Nice to have in most cases. Must have only when: pursuing Miljöbyggnad Gold/Silver, client has internal BVB mandate, or seeking differentiation through verified low-emission interiors

criticalGap.title: Reclaimed and Used Products
criticalGap.issue: No established pathway exists for assessing used/reclaimed products
barriers: Unknown chemical content (older products may contain banned substances)
Lack of original manufacturer to submit assessment
No testing framework for used materials
criticalGap.fyraImplication: Must develop equivalency frameworks demonstrating environmental benefits through alternative documentation

specificationTemplates.examples: Office chairs, lounge seating, beds, desks, casegoods

options.name: Equivalent Certification
alternatives: Cradle to Cradle Certified (Bronze minimum, Silver preferred)
EPD per ISO 14025/EN 15804 with REACH Annex XVII compliance

requirements.name: Fire Safety Testing
requirements.detail: Third-party certificate demonstrating Euroclass B-s2,d0 or better for upholstery

requirements.name: Embodied Carbon Calculation
requirements.detail: Minimum 60% carbon savings vs. new manufacture (EN 15978, RICS, or One Click LCA methodology)

requirements.name: Structural Integrity
requirements.detail: Test per EN 1728 (seating) or EN 1129 (casegoods), or engineer's assessment of remaining service life

requirements.name: Hazardous Substance Screening
requirements.detail: Minimum XRF scan for heavy metals; FTIR or lab analysis if suspect materials identified

circularDesignCriteria: Manufacturer take-back or certified recycling program
Minimum 30% recycled content by weight (post-consumer preferred)

specificationTemplates.examples: Carpet, curtains, upholstery fabric, bedding, towels

options.name: BVB Rating
options.description: 'Recommended' (Green) preferred; 'Accepted' (Yellow) minimum. Note: Limited BVB coverage for decorative textiles.

options.name: Textile-Specific Certification
alternatives: Cradle to Cradle Material Health Certificate

options.name: Performance-Based Documentation
requirements: Heavy metals: REACH Annex XVII compliance (lead <90ppm, cadmium <100ppm)
Azo dyes: Free of carcinogenic amines per EN 14362-1
Phthalates: DEHP, DBP, BBP, DIBP each <0.1% by weight

requirements.name: Chemical Screening
requirements.detail: Lab analysis confirming absence of banned substances per REACH Annex XVII

requirements.name: Fire Safety Testing
requirements.detail: Euroclass Bfl-s1 (flooring) or B-s1,d0 (curtains/upholstery) per EN 13501-1

requirements.name: Hygiene Certification
requirements.detail: Professional cleaning and sanitization per ISO 14644 or equivalent

requirements.name: Embodied Carbon Benefit
requirements.detail: Minimum 70% carbon savings vs. new manufacture

circularContent: Minimum 50% recycled content by weight (post-consumer preferred)
Manufacturer take-back program (e.g., Interface ReEntry, Tarkett ReStart)

specificationTemplates.examples: Architectural lighting, decorative fixtures, task lighting

options.name: BVB Rating
options.description: Where available (limited coverage for complete luminaires)

requirements.name: Electrical Safety
requirements.detail: CE marking verification or re-certification by qualified electrician

requirements.name: Component Replacement
requirements.detail: LED retrofit with documented energy efficiency improvement

requirements.name: Fire Safety
requirements.detail: Heat-generating components assessed for fire risk

requirements.name: Embodied Carbon
requirements.detail: Calculation demonstrating net benefit vs. new manufacture

mandatoryRequirements.electrical: CE marking or equivalent safety certification
mandatoryRequirements.efficiency: Minimum EU Energy Label class as specified by project

specificationTemplates.examples: Flooring, wall panels, ceiling systems, doors, windows

requirements.name: Structural Assessment
requirements.detail: Engineer's certification of remaining service life and load capacity

requirements.name: Hazardous Materials Screening
requirements.detail: Asbestos, lead paint, PCB testing as applicable by material age

requirements.name: Fire Performance
requirements.detail: Original fire rating documentation or re-testing per EN 13501-1

requirements.name: Acoustic Performance
requirements.detail: Testing or engineering assessment where relevant

requirements.name: Traceability
requirements.detail: Documentation of source building and material history

equivalencyFramework.title: Equivalency Framework for Reclaimed Products
equivalencyFramework.purpose: When products cannot achieve BVB rating, demonstrate equivalent environmental and health performance through alternative documentation

pathways.name: Embodied Carbon Pathway
pathways.description: Demonstrate significant carbon savings through reuse vs. new manufacture
requirements: LCA calculation per EN 15978 or equivalent methodology
Minimum 60% embodied carbon reduction vs. new equivalent
Third-party verification recommended for large projects

pathways.name: Performance Testing Pathway
pathways.description: Demonstrate product meets current performance standards through testing
requirements: Fire safety testing per relevant EN standard
Structural integrity testing per product category

pathways.name: Fire Engineer Assessment Pathway
pathways.description: Performance-based design approach with compensating measures
requirements: Document equivalent safety through compensating measures
Typical measures: enhanced sprinklers, earlier detection, shorter escape distances
pathways.bestFor: Heritage buildings, unique designs, boutique hotels

pathways.name: Insurance Pre-Approval Pathway
requirements: Document specific products and fire safety documentation
Get written confirmation of coverage terms
Common myth: 'Insurance denies coverage for reused furniture' - FALSE if fire-certified

alternativeApproach.name: Fabric Replacement
alternativeApproach.description: Replace existing fabric with fire-rated textile
